thread.title: Jets: A look ahead to Patriots - Football
thread.title_full: Jets: A look ahead to Patriots - Football - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: Jets: A look ahead to Patriots - Football
text:
Jets (4-1) at Patriots (5-0) 
At Gillette Stadium
Sunday, 1 p.m.
TV: CBS
Radio: ESPN-FM 98.7 
Early line: Patriots by 8 1/2 
The Jets, who lead the league in total defense and scoring defense, should receive quite a test from the Patriots, who lead the NFL in scoring offense and are second to San Diego in total offense. The Jets have lost seven of their last eight games against New England since their stunning upset of the Patriots in the 2010 AFC playoffs. This will be first-year coach Todd Bowles’ first game in this rivalry.
In the spotlight 
Jets QB Ryan Fitzpatrick. The veteran signal-caller is coming off a game in which he achieved his highest passer rating this season, a 113.1 mark in a victory over Washington. Fitzpatrick has been a steady and effective game manager for the Jets during their fast start, but he likely will have to be more than that if the Jets are to keep up with New England QB Tom Brady and his high-flying offense. The Patriots are averaging 36.6 points.
Game plan 
The Jets lead the league in rushing offense thanks to blossoming star Chris Ivory and an efficient offensive line. They will need to take advantage of a New England defense that has been gouged for 4.8 yards per carry. That strategy could set up favorable passing situations for Fitzpatrick against a somewhat suspect New England secondary. The defense needs to rattle Brady and make him uncomfortable in the pocket, or he will pick apart the defense. 
— J.P. Pelzman
